name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: flour, sugar, eggs, chocolate chips, butter, vanilla extract
cooking_instruction:
"1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Cream together butter and sugar.
3. Beat in eggs and vanilla.
4. Mix in flour and chocolate chips.
5. Drop spoonfuls of dough onto baking sheets.
6. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown.
7. Let cool before serving."
cooking_ingredients:
Butter: 1 cup (softened)
Sugar: 1 cup
Eggs: 2 large
Vanilla Extract: 1 tsp
Flour: 2 ¼ cups
Chocolate Chips: 1 ½ cups
Baking Soda: 1 tsp
Salt: ½ tsp

name: Pad Thai
ingredients: rice noodles, tofu, eggs, bean sprouts, peanuts, lime, fish sauce, tamarind paste, garlic, shallots
cooking_instruction:
"1. Prepare the ingredients Gather all the necessary ingredients, including rice noodles, chicken, shrimp, tofu, peanuts, scrambled eggs, and fresh vegetables."

2. Cook the noodles Soak the flat dried rice noodles in hot water for 5 minutes. Drain and set aside.

3. Prepare the Pad Thai sauce Mix together tamarind puree, fish sauce, palm sugar, and lime juice to create the Pad Thai sauce. If you can't find tamarind puree, you can substitute it with ketchup.

4. Cook the protein Cook the chicken, shrimp, and tofu in a pan with some oil until they are cooked through.

5. Add the vegetables Add the fresh vegetables, such as bean sprouts and garlic chives, to the pan and stir-fry until they are tender-crisp.

6. Add the noodles and sauce Add the cooked noodles and Pad Thai sauce to the pan and stir-fry everything together.

7. Add the peanuts and scrambled eggs Add the peanuts and scrambled eggs to the pan and stir-fry until everything is well combined.

8. Season and serve Season with salt, pepper, and lime juice to taste. Serve hot and enjoy!"
cooking_ingredients:
Pantry:

Rice noodles (1 cup)
Tamarind paste (2 tablespoons)
Fish sauce (2 tablespoons)
Palm sugar (1 tablespoon)
Soy sauce (1 tablespoon)
Vegetable oil (1 tablespoon)
Ground peanuts (1 teaspoon)
Salt (to taste)
Pepper (to taste)
Protein:

Boneless, skinless chicken breast or thighs (1 cup), cut into bite-sized pieces
OR Shrimp (1 cup), peeled and deveined
OR Firm tofu (1 cup), cut into bite-sized pieces
Vegetables:

Mixed vegetables (2 cups), such as:
Bean sprouts
Carrots
Green onions
Cabbage
Mushrooms (1 cup), sliced
Bell peppers (1 cup), sliced
Garlic (2 cloves), minced
Fresh ginger (1 tablespoon), grated
Garnishes:

Chopped peanuts (1/4 cup)
Fresh cilantro leaves (1/4 cup)
Lime wedges (2-3)
Optional ingredients:

Fresh cilantro (1/4 cup), chopped
Diced chilies (1/4 cup)
Diced lemongrass (1/4 cup)

name: Spicy Chicken Curry
ingredients: chicken, onions, tomatoes, coconut milk, curry paste, ginger, garlic, cilantro
cooking_instruction:
1. Prepare the ingredients

Measure out all the ingredients and have them ready to use.
Chop the onion, ginger, and garlic.
Cut the boneless, skinless chicken breast or thighs into bite-sized pieces.
2. Heat oil in a pan

Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Once the oil is hot, add the cumin seeds and let them sizzle for a few seconds.
3. Add onions and cook until golden

Add the chopped onions to the pan and cook until they are golden brown (about 5 minutes).
Stir occasionally to prevent burning.
4. Add ginger and garlic

Add the chopped ginger and garlic to the pan and cook for 1 minute, until fragrant.
5. Add the chicken

Add the chicken pieces to the pan and cook until they are browned on all sides (about 5-7 minutes).
Remove the chicken from the pan and set it aside.
6. Add curry powder and cook for 1 minute

Add the curry powder to the pan and cook for 1 minute, until fragrant.
Stir constantly to prevent burning.
7. Add coconut milk and diced tomatoes

Add the coconut milk and diced tomatoes to the pan.
Stir well to combine and bring to a simmer.
8. Add the chicken back in and season with salt and spices

Add the browned chicken back to the pan and stir to coat with the curry sauce.
Season with salt, cayenne pepper (or red pepper flakes), and garam masala.
9. Simmer the curry

Reduce the heat to low and simmer the curry for 20-25 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
Stir occasionally to prevent burning.
10. Serve and enjoy!

Serve the Spicy Chicken Curry hot, garnished with fresh cilantro and basmati rice or naan bread.
Adjust the level of spiciness to your taste by adding more or less cayenne pepper.
cooking_ingredients:
Protein:

1 1/2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken breast or thighs, cut into 1-inch pieces
Aromatics:

2 medium onions, diced
3-4 cloves of garlic, minced
1 medium ginger, grated
2-3 dried red chilies, crushed or 1-2 teaspoon red pepper flakes
1 teaspoon ground cumin
1 teaspoon curry powder
Spices:

1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder
1/2 teaspoon garam masala powder
1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional, adjust to taste)
Salt, to taste
Coconut Milk and Liquid:

1 can (14 oz) diced tomatoes
1 cup coconut milk
1/2 cup chicken broth or water
2 tablespoons tomato paste
Oils and Flavorings:

2 tablespoons vegetable oil or coconut oil
2 tablespoons butter or ghee (optional)
Fresh cilantro, chopped (for garnish)
Other:

Fresh or frozen bell peppers, potatoes, or other vegetables of your choice (optional)
Feel free to adjust the spice level and ingredients based on your personal preferences and dietary needs!

name: Chocolate Cake
description: A rich and moist chocolate cake
ingredients: flour, sugar, eggs, cocoa powder, milk, vegetable oil, baking powder, vanilla extract
cooking_instruction:
"Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Prepare pan: Spray a 9 by 9 or 8 by 8-inch baking dish with non-stick cooking spray then dust with a little cocoa. Shake out excess cocoa.
Whisk dry ingredients: In a large mixing bowl whisk together flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt.
Mix in wet ingredients: Add buttermilk, oil, vanilla and eggs. Whisk mixture until very well blended (about 1 minute).
Pour batter into prepared baking dish.
Bake in preheated oven until toothpick inserted into the center of cake comes out clean, about 27 to 35 minutes.
Let cool completely on a wire rack."
cooking_ingredients:
2 1/4 cups all-purpose flour
1 1/2 cups granulated sugar
2 teaspoons baking powder
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder
1 cup buttermilk
1/2 cup vegetable oil
2 large eggs
2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract
For the Ganache (optional):

1 cup semisweet chocolate chips
1/2 cup heavy cream
Optional:

Chopped nuts or chocolate chips for added flavor and texture
You'll also need:

Non-stick cooking spray
Cocoa powder for dusting the pan

name: Pancakes
ingredients: flour, milk, eggs, butter, baking powder, sugar, salt
cooking_instruction:
Step 1: Prepare the Batter

In a large bowl, whisk together:
1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
3 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
1 teaspoon salt
1 cup granulated sugar
In a separate bowl, whisk together:
1 cup milk
1 large egg
2 tablespoons melted butter
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
Combine wet and dry ingredients: Whisk until just combined. The batter should still be slightly lumpy.
Step 2: Cook the Pancakes

Heat a non-stick skillet or griddle: Over medium heat. Grease with butter or cooking spray if necessary.
Drop batter by 1/4 cupfuls: Onto the skillet or griddle.
Cook for 2-3 minutes: Until bubbles appear on the surface and the edges start to dry.
Flip and cook for another 1-2 minutes: Until golden brown.
Serve hot: With your favorite toppings, such as syrup, butter, fruit, whipped cream, or powdered sugar.
Tips:

Use a thermometer to ensure the skillet or griddle is at the right temperature (375°F).
Don't overmix the batter, as this will create tough pancakes.
Don't overcrowd the skillet or griddle, cook in batches if necessary.
Keep the pancakes warm in a 200°F oven while cooking the remaining batter.
cooking_ingredients:
1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
3 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
1 teaspoon salt
1 cup granulated sugar
1 cup milk
1 large egg
2 tablespoons melted butter
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
Optional:

Blueberries, chocolate chips, or other mix-ins of your choice
Fresh fruit, whipped cream, or syrup for topping
Pancake Variations:

Buttermilk Pancakes: Replace milk with 1 cup buttermilk
Protein Pancakes: Add 1 scoop of your favorite protein powder
Gluten-Free Pancakes: Replace flour with 1 1/2 cups gluten-free flour blend
Pantry Staples:

Baking powder
Salt
Granulated sugar
All-purpose flour

name: Spaghetti Bolognese
ingredients: ground beef, tomatoes, pasta, onions, garlic, carrots, celery, red wine, beef broth
cooking_instruction:
Step 1: Prepare the Meat Sauce

Chop the onion, garlic, carrot, and celery: Finely chop the vegetables to release their flavors and textures.
Cook the aromatics: Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the chopped onion, garlic, carrot, and celery, and cook until they're softened and fragrant, about 8-10 minutes.
Add the ground beef: Add the ground beef to the pot, breaking it up with a spoon or spatula as it cooks. Cook until the beef is no longer pink, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the tomato paste: Add the tomato paste to the pot and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly, until it's fragrant and darkened in color.
Add the canned tomatoes and wine (if using): Add the canned tomatoes, salt, and black pepper to the pot. If using red wine, add it now. Stir well to combine.
Simmer the sauce: Bring the sauce to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer, covered, for at least 2 hours or overnight. The longer it cooks, the richer the flavors will be.
Step 2: Cook the Spaghetti

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil: Fill a large pot with salted water and bring it to a boil.
Cook the spaghetti: Add the spaghetti to the boiling water and cook until al dente, about 8-10 minutes. Reserve 1 cup of pasta water before draining the spaghetti.
Step 3: Combine the Spaghetti and Meat Sauce

Add the cooked spaghetti to the meat sauce: Add the cooked spaghetti to the meat sauce pot, tossing to combine. If the sauce seems too thick, add some of the reserved pasta water.
Season and serve: Season the spaghetti with salt and black pepper to taste. Serve hot, topped with grated Parmesan cheese and chopped fresh parsley (if desired).
Tips and Variations:

Use a slow cooker: Brown the meat and cook the aromatics, then transfer everything to a slow cooker and cook on low for 6-8 hours.
Add other ingredients: Consider adding other ingredients like mushrooms, bell peppers, or bacon to the meat sauce for added flavor and texture.
Use different types of meat: You can substitute ground beef with ground pork, ground turkey, or a combination of meats for a different flavor profile.
Make it vegetarian or vegan: Replace the ground beef with a plant-based protein source, such as tofu or tempeh, and adjust the seasonings accordingly.
cooking_ingredients:
Meat Sauce:

1 pound ground beef (80/20 or 70/30 lean to fat ratio works well)
1 medium onion, finely chopped
2 cloves of garlic, minced
1 medium carrot, finely chopped
1 celery stalk, finely chopped
1 (28 oz) can whole peeled tomatoes
1 tablespoon tomato paste
1 teaspoon dried basil
1 teaspoon dried oregano
Salt and black pepper, to taste
1/4 cup red wine (optional)
Spaghetti:

1 pound spaghetti
Cheese:

1 cup grated Parmesan cheese
Other:

Olive oil, for cooking
Fresh parsley, chopped (optional)
Optional Ingredients:

Mushrooms, sliced
Bell peppers, sliced
Other vegetables of your choice
Bacon, diced (adds a smoky flavor)
Red pepper flakes, for some heat
Pantry Staples:

Canned tomatoes
Tomato paste
Dried herbs (basil, oregano)
Salt and black pepper
Olive oil

name: Chicken Noodle Soup
ingredients: chicken, noodles, carrots, celery, onions, thyme, parsley
cooking_instruction:
Step 1: Prepare the Chicken and Vegetables
Chop 1 large onion, 3 cloves of garlic, 2 medium carrots, and 2 stalks of celery.
Season 1 pound of boneless, skinless chicken breast or thighs with salt, pepper, thyme, and basil.
Step 2: Sear the Chicken and Vegetables
Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken to the pot and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the chicken from the pot and set aside.
Add the chopped onion, garlic, carrots, and celery to the pot. Cook until the vegetables are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
Step 3: Add the Chicken Broth and Simmer
Add 4 cups of chicken broth to the pot, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom.
Return the chicken to the pot.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer, covered, for 15-20 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
Step 4: Add Potatoes and Noodles (Optional)
If using potatoes, add 2 peeled and chopped potatoes to the pot and continue to simmer for another 15-20 minutes or until they're tender.
If using noodles, cook them according to package instructions and add them to the pot during the last 5 minutes of cooking.
Step 5: Season and Serve
Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed.
Serve the chicken soup hot, garnished with chopped fresh herbs or a sprinkle of paprika, if desired.


Cooking Time: 6-8 hours

Step 1: Prepare the Chicken and Vegetables
Chop 1 large onion, 3 cloves of garlic, 2 medium carrots, and 2 stalks of celery.
Season 1 pound of boneless, skinless chicken breast or thighs with salt, pepper, thyme, and basil.
Step 2: Brown the Chicken and Vegetables
Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken to the skillet and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
Add the chopped onion, garlic, carrots, and celery to the skillet. Cook until the vegetables are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
Step 3: Add to Slow Cooker
Add the browned chicken, vegetables, and 4 cups of chicken broth to the slow cooker.
Cook on low for 6-8 hours or until the chicken is cooked through.
Step 4: Add Potatoes and Noodles (Optional)
If using potatoes, add 2 peeled and chopped potatoes to the slow cooker during the last 2 hours of cooking.
If using noodles, cook them according to package instructions and add them to the slow cooker during the last 30 minutes of cooking.
Step 5: Season and Serve
Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed.
Serve the chicken soup hot, garnished with chopped fresh herbs or a sprinkle of paprika, if desired.
cooking_ingredients:
For a simple recipe:

Chicken: 3-pound whole chicken
Vegetables: Carrots, celery, and an onion
Seasonings: Salt, pepper, and chicken bouillon granules (optional)
For a more flavorful recipe:

Chicken: 2-3 pound whole chicken
Vegetables: 3 stalks celery with leaves, 1 pound baby carrots, 2 onions
Broth: 10 cups water, 2 (14.5 ounce) cans low-sodium chicken broth, 2 cubes beef bouillon
Spices and herbs: 5 black peppercorns, 2 bay leaves, 1 pinch dried thyme, 1 pinch poultry seasoning, 1 pinch dried basil, 1 pinch dried parsley
Pasta: 1 (8 ounce) package farfalle (bow tie) pasta (optional)
You can also add other ingredients like garlic, ginger, or chili flakes to give your soup an extra boost of flavor.

name: Apple Pie
ingredients: apples, sugar, flour, butter, cinnamon, nutmeg, lemon juice
cooking_instruction:
Step 1: Make the Crust

In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour and salt.
Add the cubed butter and use a pastry blender or your fingers to work the butter into the flour until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Gradually add the ice-cold water, stirring with a fork until the dough comes together in a ball.
Divide the dough in half and shape into disks. Wrap each disk in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Step 2: Prepare the Filling

In a large bowl, combine the sliced apples, granulated sugar, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt. Mix until the apples are evenly coated.
Add the pieces of butter to the apple mixture and toss until they're distributed throughout.
Step 3: Assemble the Pie

Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
On a lightly floured surface, roll out one of the chilled dough disks to a thickness of about 1/8 inch.
Transfer the dough to a 9-inch pie dish and trim the edges to fit.
Fill the pie crust with the apple mixture and dot the top with any remaining butter pieces.
Roll out the second dough disk to a thickness of about 1/8 inch. Use this dough to cover the pie and crimp the edges to seal.
Cut a few slits in the top crust to allow steam to escape during baking.
Step 4: Bake the Pie

Place the pie on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake for 45-50 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the apples are tender.
Cover the edges with foil if they start to brown too quickly.
Remove the pie from the oven and let it cool on a wire rack for at least 30 minutes before serving.
Tips and Variations:

Use a variety of apple types, such as Granny Smith and Honeycrisp, for a more complex flavor profile.
Add a splash of vanilla extract or a pinch of nutmeg to the apple mixture for extra flavor.
Try using a lattice-top crust or a crumb topping instead of a traditional top crust.
Serve the pie with a scoop of vanilla ice cream or whipped cream for an extra-special treat.
cooking_ingredients:
For the Crust:

2 1/4 cups all-purpose flour
1 tsp salt
1 cup cold unsalted butter, cut into small cubes
1/4 cup ice-cold water
For the Filling:

6-8 medium-sized apples, peeled and sliced
1/2 cup granulated sugar
2 tbsp all-purpose flour
1 tsp cinnamon
1/4 tsp nutmeg
1/4 tsp salt
1/4 cup butter, cut into small pieces

name: Vegetable Curry
ingredients: mixed vegetables, coconut milk, curry paste, onions, garlic, ginger, vegetable broth
cooking_instruction:
Step 1: Prepare the Spice Blend

In a small bowl, combine the cumin, curry powder, turmeric, and cayenne pepper (if using).
Step 2: Sauté the Onions, Garlic, and Ginger

Heat 2 tablespoons of oil or ghee in a large pan over medium heat.
Add the diced onions and sauté until they're translucent and starting to brown (about 5 minutes).
Add the minced garlic and grated ginger and sauté for another minute.
Step 3: Add the Bell Pepper and Mixed Vegetables

Add the diced red bell pepper and sauté for 2-3 minutes, until it starts to soften.
Add the mixed vegetables and sauté for another 2-3 minutes, until they're tender-crisp.
Step 4: Add the Spice Blend and Diced Tomatoes

Add the prepared spice blend and sauté for 1 minute, until the spices are fragrant.
Add the diced tomatoes and stir well to combine.
Step 5: Add the Coconut Milk and Simmer

Pour in the coconut milk and stir well to combine.
Bring the mixture to a simmer and let it cook for 10-15 minutes, until the sauce has thickened and the flavors have melded together.
Step 6: Season and Serve

Season the curry with salt and pepper to taste.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve over rice, with naan bread, or with some roti.
Tips and Variations:

Use a variety of vegetables, such as cauliflower, sweet potatoes, and zucchini, to change up the flavor and texture.
Add some protein, such as chickpeas, tofu, or chicken, to make the curry more substantial.
Use different types of milk, such as almond or soy milk, for a non-dairy version.
Add some heat, such as diced jalapeños or serrano peppers, for an extra spicy kick.
Experiment with different spice blends, such as garam masala or curry leaves, to change up the flavor.
cooking_ingredients:
2 medium-sized onions, diced
3 cloves of garlic, minced
1 medium-sized ginger, grated
1 red bell pepper, diced
1 can (14 oz) diced tomatoes
1 cup mixed vegetables (such as carrots, potatoes, green beans, and peas)
1 teaspoon ground cumin
1 teaspoon curry powder
1/2 teaspoon turmeric
1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional)
1 can (14 oz) coconut milk
Salt and pepper, to taste
Fresh cilantro, for garnish
Cooking oil or ghee, for frying

name: Sushi
description: A Japanese dish of vinegared rice with various toppings
ingredients: sushi rice, nori, fish ,salmon,tuna, cucumber, avocado, rice vinegar, wasabi, soy sauce
cooking_instruction:
Step 1: Prepare the Sushi Rice

Rinse the sushi rice thoroughly and cook it according to the package instructions using a rice cooker or medium saucepan.
In a small saucepan, combine 1/4 cup of rice vinegar, 1 tablespoon of sugar, and 1 teaspoon of salt. Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat to low.
Once the rice is cooked, transfer it to a large bowl and pour the vinegar mixture over the rice. Mix well to combine and let it cool to room temperature.
Step 2: Prepare the Fillings

Cut your fillings of choice into thin slices or strips.
Set aside until ready to assemble the sushi.
Step 3: Assemble the Sushi

Lay a nori sheet flat on a cutting board or other surface.
Spread a thin layer of sushi rice onto the nori, leaving about 1 inch of space at the top.
Arrange your fillings in the middle of the rice.
Roll the sushi using a sushi mat or your hands, applying gentle pressure to form a compact roll.
Slice the roll into individual pieces using a sharp knife.
Step 4: Serve and Enjoy

Serve your sushi with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger, if desired.
Experiment with different fillings and toppings to create your own unique sushi creations.
Tips and Variations:

Use short-grain Japanese rice, as it's specifically designed to hold together well when cooked.
Experiment with different fillings, such as spicy tuna or crab, to add variety to your sushi.
Try using different types of nori, such as toasted nori or nori with added flavorings.
Add some crunch to your sushi by topping it with toasted sesame seeds or chopped nuts.
Make inside-out sushi (uramaki) by wrapping the filling in nori and then covering it with sushi rice.
cooking_ingredients:
Sushi rice (short-grain Japanese rice)
Nori (seaweed sheets)
Fillings of your choice (e.g. salmon, tuna, cucumber, avocado, carrot, etc.)
Rice vinegar
Sugar
Salt
Water

name: Caesar Salad
description: A classic salad with a creamy dressing
ingredients: romaine lettuce, croutons, parmesan cheese, caesar dressing, anchovies, garlic
cooking_instruction:
Step 1: Prepare the Croutons

Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
Cut 1/2 loaf of Italian bread (about 1 pound) into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes.
Toss the bread cubes with 2 tablespoons of olive oil, 1/2 teaspoon of salt, and 1/4 teaspoon of black pepper until the bread is evenly coated.
Spread the bread cubes on a baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until crispy and golden brown.
Remove the croutons from the oven and let them cool completely.
Step 2: Make the Caesar Dressing (optional)

If you want to make your own Caesar dressing, combine the following ingredients in a blender or food processor:
2 cloves of garlic, minced
2 anchovy fillets, finely minced (optional)
1 egg yolk
2 tablespoons of freshly squeezed lemon juice
1 teaspoon of Dijon mustard
1/2 cup of olive oil
Salt and pepper to taste
Blend the ingredients until smooth and creamy.
Taste and adjust the dressing as needed.
Step 3: Prepare the Lettuce

Wash and dry 3 hearts of romaine lettuce (about 20 ounces).
Remove the tough outer leaves and tear the lettuce into bite-sized pieces.
Place the lettuce in a large bowl and refrigerate until ready to assemble the salad.
Step 4: Assemble the Salad

Remove the lettuce from the refrigerator and add the cooled croutons on top.
Sprinkle 1/2 cup of shaved or grated Parmesan cheese over the salad.
Drizzle the Caesar dressing (homemade or store-bought) over the salad and toss to coat.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Step 5: Serve and Enjoy

Serve the Caesar salad immediately, garnished with additional Parmesan cheese and a sprinkle of black pepper if desired.
Enjoy your delicious and classic Caesar salad!
cooking_ingredients:
1 large or 2 small heads of romaine lettuce
Parmesan cheese, shredded or shaved
Crisp croutons (you can make your own or use store-bought)
Caesar salad dressing (you can make your own or use store-bought)
For homemade croutons, you'll need:

1/2 French Baguette, cut in half and thinly sliced
3 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil
1 tsp minced garlic
2 Tbsp grated Parmesan cheese
For homemade Caesar salad dressing, you'll need:

2 small garlic cloves, minced
2 tsp dijon mustard
1 tsp Worcestershire sauce
2 tsp fresh lemon juice
1 1/2 tsp red wine vinegar
1/3 cup extra virgin olive oil
1/2 tsp sea salt
1/8 tsp black pepper

name: Tomato Soup
description: A comforting soup perfect for cold days
ingredients: tomatoes, onions, garlic, vegetable broth, cream, basil
cooking_instruction:
Step 1: Heat Oil and Sauté Onion

Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add 1 medium chopped onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Step 2: Add Garlic and Cook

Add 2 cloves of minced garlic and cook for 1 minute more.
Step 3: Add Tomatoes and Broth

Add 2 (28-ounce) cans of whole tomatoes, with their juice.
Add 4 cups of vegetable broth.
Add 1 teaspoon of sugar (optional).
Add 1 bay leaf.
Step 4: Bring to a Boil and Simmer

Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 30 minutes.
Step 5: Remove Bay Leaf and Puree

Remove the bay leaf from the pot.
Use an immersion blender or a regular blender in batches to puree the soup until smooth.
Step 6: Add Heavy Cream (Optional)

If using, stir in 1/2 cup of heavy cream.
Step 7: Season and Heat

Season the soup with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
Heat the soup over medium heat until hot.
Step 8: Add Fresh Basil and Serve

Stir in 2 tablespoons of chopped fresh basil.
Serve the soup immediately.
cooking_ingredients:
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 medium onion, chopped
2 cloves garlic, minced
2 (28-ounce) cans whole tomatoes, with their juice
4 cups vegetable broth
1 teaspoon sugar (optional)
1 bay leaf
1/2 cup heavy cream (optional)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
2 tablespoons chopped fresh basil

name: Beef Tacos
ingredients: ground beef, taco shells, lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, sour cream, taco seasoning
cooking_instruction:
Step 1: Prepare the Beef

In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of oil over medium-high heat.
Add 1 pound of ground beef (80/20 or 70/30 works well) and cook until browned, breaking it up into small pieces as it cooks.
Once browned, drain excess fat from the skillet.
Step 2: Add Aromatics

Add 1 medium onion, diced, and 2 cloves of garlic, minced, to the skillet. Cook until the onion is translucent, about 3-4 minutes.
Step 3: Add Taco Seasoning

Add 1 packet of taco seasoning (or homemade blend of chili powder, cumin, paprika, and salt) to the skillet and stir to combine.
Cook for 1-2 minutes, until the flavors are fragrant.
Step 4: Add Liquid

Add 1/2 cup of beef broth or water to the skillet and stir to combine.
Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for 5-7 minutes, until the liquid has reduced slightly and the flavors have melded together.
Step 5: Prepare Tacos

Warm tortillas according to package instructions (usually by wrapping them in a damp paper towel and microwaving for 20-30 seconds).
Assemble tacos by spooning the beef mixture onto a tortilla, followed by your desired toppings (such as shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, shredded cheese, sour cream, and salsa).
Optional Toppings:

Shredded lettuce
Diced tomatoes
Shredded cheese (cheddar or Monterey Jack work well)
Sour cream
Salsa
Avocado or guacamole
Cilantro
Crushed tortilla chips
cooking_ingredients:
Meat:

1 pound ground beef (80/20 or 70/30 works well)
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
Aromatics:

1 medium onion, diced
2 cloves garlic, minced
Taco Seasoning:

1 packet of taco seasoning (or homemade blend of chili powder, cumin, paprika, and salt)
Liquid:

1/2 cup beef broth or water
Tortillas:

8-10 corn tortillas (or flour tortillas, if preferred)
Toppings:

Shredded lettuce
Diced tomatoes
Shredded cheese (cheddar or Monterey Jack work well)
Sour cream
Salsa
Avocado or guacamole (optional)
Cilantro (optional)
Crushed tortilla chips (optional)
Optional Ingredients:

Diced bell peppers (any color)
Jalapeños or other hot peppers (for added heat)
Refried beans or Mexican rice (for a filling meal)
Roasted vegetables (such as carrots, zucchini, or sweet potatoes)
Spices and Seasonings:

Salt and pepper, to taste
Cumin (optional, for added flavor)
Chili powder (optional, for added heat)
Miscellaneous:

Cooking utensils (spatula, tongs, etc.)
Plates, napkins, and utensils for serving

name: Vegetable Stir Fry
description: A quick and healthy Asian-inspired dish
ingredients: mixed vegetables, tofu, soy sauce, sesame oil, ginger, garlic, rice
cooking_instruction:
Step 1: Prepare the Vegetables

Choose your favorite vegetables (see suggestions below) and wash them thoroughly.
Peel and chop the vegetables into bite-sized pieces.
Set aside.
Step 2: Heat the Wok or Pan

Heat 1-2 tablespoons of oil (vegetable, peanut, or sesame oil work well) in a large wok or frying pan over medium-high heat.
Once the oil is hot, swirl it around to coat the pan.
Step 3: Add Aromatics

Add 1-2 cloves of minced garlic and 1 small onion, thinly sliced, to the pan.
Stir-fry until the garlic is fragrant and the onion is translucent, about 2-3 minutes.
Step 4: Add Vegetables

Add the chopped vegetables to the pan in the following order:
Harder vegetables (broccoli, carrots, bell peppers) first, stir-frying for 2-3 minutes.
Softer vegetables (mushrooms, snow peas, green beans) next, stir-frying for another 2-3 minutes.
Leafy greens (spinach, kale, bok choy) last, stir-frying until wilted.
Stir-fry constantly to ensure even cooking and to prevent burning.
Step 5: Add Seasonings

Add your desired seasonings to the pan, such as:
Soy sauce or tamari for a savory flavor
Oyster sauce for a rich, umami flavor
Chili flakes or sriracha for a spicy kick
Grated ginger for added depth
Stir-fry for another minute to combine the flavors.
Step 6: Serve

Serve the vegetable stir fry hot over rice, noodles, or enjoy as a standalone dish.
Garnish with chopped green onions, sesame seeds, or a sprinkle of soy sauce, if desired.
Vegetable Suggestions:

Broccoli
Carrots
Bell peppers
Mushrooms
Snow peas
Green beans
Spinach
Kale
Bok choy
Zucchini
Yellow squash
Corn
Baby corn
Tips and Variations:

Use a variety of colorful vegetables to make the dish visually appealing.
Add protein sources like tofu, tempeh, or cooked chicken or shrimp for added nutrition.
Experiment with different seasonings and sauces to change up the flavor profile.
Add nuts or seeds like cashews, almonds, or sesame seeds for added crunch.
Serve with a side of steamed dumplings or egg rolls for a complete meal.
Enjoy your delicious and healthy vegetable stir fry!
cooking_ingredients:
Oils:

1-2 tablespoons vegetable oil (peanut oil, avocado oil, or grapeseed oil work well)
Optional: 1 teaspoon sesame oil for added flavor
Aromatics:

2-3 cloves garlic, minced
1 small onion, thinly sliced

Vegetables:

Choose 3-5 of your favorite vegetables from the list below:
Broccoli (1 bunch)

Bell peppers (2-3 medium)
Mushrooms (1 cup)
Snow peas (1 cup)
Green beans (1 cup)
Spinach (1 bunch)
Kale (1 bunch)
Bok choy (1 bunch)
Zucchini (1 medium)
Yellow squash (1 medium)
Corn (1 cup)
Baby corn (1 cup)
Seasonings:

1-2 teaspoons soy sauce (or tamari for gluten-free)
1 teaspoon oyster sauce (optional)

Salt and pepper, to taste
Optional: chili flakes or sriracha for added heat
Garnishes:

Chopped green onions, for garnish
Sesame seeds, for garnish

Miscellaneous:

Cooking utensils (wok or large frying pan, spatula, etc.)
Plates and utensils for serving
Optional Ingredients:

Protein sources: tofu, tempeh, cooked chicken, shrimp, or beef
Nuts or seeds: cashews, almonds, sesame seeds, or pumpkin seeds
Other seasonings: hoisin sauce, rice vinegar, or honey
Feel free to customize the ingredients based on your personal preferences and dietary needs!

name: Lemon Meringue Pie
ingredients: pie crust, lemons, sugar, cornstarch, eggs, butter
cooking_instruction:
Here are the cooking instructions for a classic lemon meringue pie:

Step 1: Make the Pie Crust

Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large bowl, whisk together 2 1/4 cups all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 cup cold unsalted butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Gradually add 1/4 cup ice-cold water, stirring with a fork until the dough comes together.
Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
Roll out the dough on a floured surface to a thickness of about 1/8 inch.
Transfer the dough to a 9-inch pie dish and trim the edges to fit.
Crimp the edges to form a decorative border.
Step 2: Blind Bake the Pie Crust

Line the pie crust with parchment paper and fill with pie weights or dried beans.
Bake for 15 minutes.
Remove the parchment paper and pie weights or beans.
Continue baking for an additional 5-7 minutes, or until the crust is lightly golden.
Step 3: Prepare the Lemon Filling

In a medium bowl, whisk together 5 large egg yolks, 1 and 1/3 cups water, 1 cup granulated sugar, 1/3 cup cornstarch, and 1/4 teaspoon salt.
Add 1/2 cup fresh lemon juice, 1 tablespoon lemon zest, and 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened to room temperature.
Whisk until smooth and well combined.
Step 4: Pour in the Lemon Filling

Pour the lemon filling into the baked pie crust.
Bake for 15 minutes, or until the filling is set.
Step 5: Prepare the Meringue Topping

In a clean bowl, beat 5 large egg whites and 1 teaspoon cream of tartar until soft peaks form.
Gradually add 1 cup granulated sugar and continue beating until stiff peaks form.
Step 6: Top with Meringue

Spread the meringue topping over the lemon filling, making sure to seal the edges of the meringue to the pie crust.
Use a spatula to create decorative peaks and swirls.
Step 7: Bake the Meringue

Bake the pie for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the meringue is golden brown.
Step 8: Cool and Serve

Remove the pie from the oven and let it cool to room temperature.
Serve the lemon meringue pie chilled, garnished with whipped cream or fresh fruit if desired.
cooking_ingredients:
For the Pie Crust:

2 1/4 cups all-purpose flour
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup cold unsalted butter, cut into small pieces
1/4 cup ice-cold water
For the Lemon Filling:

5 large egg yolks
1 and 1/3 cups water
1 cup granulated sugar
1/3 cup cornstarch
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice
1 tablespoon grated lemon zest
2 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened to room temperature
For the Meringue Topping:

5 large egg whites
1 teaspoon cream of tartar
1 cup granulated sugar
Optional:

Whipped cream or fresh fruit for garnish.

name: Mushroom Risotto
ingredients: arborio rice, mushrooms, onions, white wine, vegetable broth, parmesan cheese, butter
cooking_instruction:
Step 1: Prepare the Broth

Heat 4-6 cups of chicken broth (homemade or store-bought) in a separate pot and keep it warm.
You can add scraps of shallots, chives, and mushroom stems to the broth for extra flavor.
Step 2: Sauté the Mushrooms and Shallots

Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add 1 cup of mixed mushrooms (such as shiitake, oyster, king oyster, and chanterelle) and 1 shallot, chopped.
Cook until the mushrooms release their liquid and start to brown, about 5 minutes.
Step 3: Add Arborio Rice

Add 1 cup of Arborio rice to the skillet and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly.
The rice should be coated in oil and slightly toasted.
Step 4: Add White Wine

Add 1/2 cup of white wine to the skillet and cook until the liquid is almost completely absorbed, stirring constantly.
Step 5: Add Broth and Cook Risotto

Add 1/2 cup of warm broth to the skillet and cook, stirring constantly, until the liquid is almost completely absorbed.
Repeat this process, adding the broth in 1/2 cup increments, and waiting for it to be absorbed before adding more.
This process should take about 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and creamy.
Step 6: Add Parmesan Cheese and Fresh Herbs

Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in 1/4 cup of grated Parmesan cheese and 1 tablespoon of chopped fresh thyme.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Step 7: Serve

Serve the mushroom risotto immediately, garnished with additional Parmesan cheese and fresh parsley if desired.
cooking_ingredients:
Pantry:

Arborio rice (1 cup)
White wine (1/2 cup) (optional)
Chicken broth (4-6 cups)
Olive oil (2 tablespoons)
Butter (2 tablespoons)
Salt (to taste)
Black pepper (to taste)
Fresh thyme (chopped, for garnish) (optional)
Fresh ingredients:

Mixed mushrooms (4 cups) (such as shiitake, oyster, king oyster, and chanterelle)
Shallot (1 small)
Garlic (2 cloves)
Fresh parsley (chopped, for garnish) (optional)
Dairy:

Parmesan cheese (1/4 cup, grated)
Miscellaneous:

Water (for cooking Arborio rice)
Optional ingredients:

Truffle oil (for added luxury)
Shaved truffles (for added luxury)
Asparagus, bell peppers, or cooked sausage (for added flavor and texture)
Substitutions:

Vegetable broth can be used instead of chicken broth for a vegetarian option.
Other types of mushrooms can be used, such as cremini, portobello, or button mushrooms.
Shallots can be substituted with onions or scallions.
Garlic can be substituted with garlic powder or minced garlic from a jar.
Fresh thyme can be substituted with dried thyme or omitted altogether.

name: BBQ Ribs
ingredients: pork ribs, bbq sauce, brown sugar, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder
cooking_instruction:
Step 1: Prepare the Ribs
Choose your preferred type of pork ribs, such as baby back ribs, spare ribs, country-style, or St. Louis-style.

Step 2: Season the Ribs
Generously season the ribs with salt and pepper. You can also use your favorite BBQ spice rub or seasoned salt.

Step 3: Bake the Ribs
Cover a baking sheet with foil and place the ribs on it. Cover the baking sheet tightly with foil and bake in a preheated oven at 250°F (275°F for baby back ribs) for 3-1/2 hours. If your rack of ribs is larger than 3lbs, add an additional 30 minutes baking time per additional 1/2 — 1lb ribs.

Step 4: Drain Excess Liquid
Carefully remove the foil and drain off any excess liquid that might be present.

Step 5: Slather with BBQ Sauce
Slather the tops of the ribs with your favorite BBQ sauce. You can use a sweeter BBQ sauce like Stubb's Sticky Sweet BBQ Sauce. Bake for an additional 30 minutes to get a caramelized, lacquered top.

Step 6: Rest, Slice, and Serve
Let the ribs rest for 15 minutes or so before slicing and serving. The meat should fall off the bone, and it's sure to be tender and delicious!

Enjoy your oven-baked BBQ ribs!
cooking_ingredients:
For the Ribs:

2-3 pounds pork ribs (baby back ribs, spare ribs, country-style, or St. Louis-style)
Salt
Pepper
For the Dry Rub (optional):

2 tablespoons brown sugar
2 tablespoons smoked paprika
1 tablespoon chili powder
1 tablespoon ground cumin
1 tablespoon garlic powder
1 tablespoon onion powder
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon black pepper
1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional, for some heat)
For the BBQ Sauce:

1 cup BBQ sauce (you can use your favorite store-bought or homemade sauce)
Some popular BBQ sauce options include:
Sweet Baby Ray's BBQ Sauce
Stubb's Sticky Sweet BBQ Sauce
Kansas City Masterpiece BBQ Sauce
Homemade BBQ sauce (recipe below)
Homemade BBQ Sauce Recipe (optional):

1 cup ketchup
1/2 cup apple cider vinegar
2 tablespoons brown sugar
2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce
1 teaspoon smoked paprika
1 teaspoon garlic powder
1 teaspoon onion powder
Salt and pepper to taste
Other:

Aluminum foil
Baking sheet

name: Greek Salad
ingredients: cucumbers, tomatoes, red onions, feta cheese, olives, olive oil, lemon juice, oregano
cooking_instruction:
Prepare the ingredients:
Wash and dry the mixed greens.
Cut the cherry tomatoes in half.
Slice the cucumber into thin rounds.
Pit the Kalamata olives.
Crumble the Feta cheese.
Thinly slice the red onion.
Slice the red bell pepper into thin strips.
Assemble the salad:
In a large bowl, combine the mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, olives, Feta cheese, red onion, and red bell pepper.
Make the dressing:
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, and dried oregano.
Season the dressing with salt and pepper to taste.
Dress the salad:
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Top with croutons:
Sprinkle the croutons over the salad.
Garnish with extra Feta (optional):
Sprinkle a little extra crumbled Feta cheese over the salad for extra flavor and texture.
Serve and enjoy:
Serve the Greek salad immediately, or cover and refrigerate for up to 2 hours before serving.
Tips and Variations:

Use high-quality ingredients, like fresh and flavorful tomatoes and good-quality Feta cheese.
Add some protein to the salad, like grilled chicken, salmon, or tofu, for a more substantial meal.
Substitute the red bell pepper with another color bell pepper or a diced avocado for added creaminess.
Omit the croutons for a lower-carb option or use gluten-free croutons for a gluten-free diet.
Experiment with different types of cheese, like goat cheese or ricotta salata, for a unique flavor profile.
cooking_ingredients:
4-6 cups mixed greens ( Romaine, Iceberg, or a blend)
1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
1 cup cucumber, sliced
1 cup Kalamata olives, pitted
1 cup crumbled Feta cheese
1/2 cup red onion, thinly sliced
1/4 cup red bell pepper, sliced
1/4 cup croutons (store-bought or homemade)
2 tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil
2 tbsp. red wine vinegar
1 tsp. dried oregano
Salt and pepper to taste
1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese for garnish (optional)

name: Chicken Tikka Masala
ingredients: chicken, yogurt, tomato sauce, cream, onions, garlic, ginger, garam masala
cooking_instruction:
Step 1: Marinate the chicken

In a large bowl, whisk together the yogurt, lemon juice, ghee or oil, garam masala, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, cardamom, cayenne pepper (if using), salt, and pepper.
Add the chicken to the marinade and mix well to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Step 2: Grill or bake the chicken

Preheat the grill to medium-high heat or the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Remove the chicken from the marinade, letting any excess liquid drip off.
Grill the chicken for 6-8 minutes per side, or until cooked through. Alternatively, bake the chicken for 15-20 minutes, or until cooked through.
Let the chicken rest for a few minutes before cutting it into bite-sized pieces.
Step 3: Make the masala sauce

Heat 1 tablespoon of ghee or oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
Add the diced onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute, until fragrant.
Stir in the diced tomatoes, chicken broth, heavy cream, tomato paste, garam masala, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Bring the sauce to a simmer and cook for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce has thickened slightly.
Step 4: Assemble and serve

Add the cooked chicken to the masala sauce and stir to coat.
Simmer the chicken in the sauce for 2-3 minutes, until heated through.
Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed.
Serve the Chicken Tikka Masala hot, garnished with fresh cilantro and basmati rice or naan bread, if desired.
Tips and Variations:

Use bone-in chicken for more flavor and texture.
Add bell peppers, cauliflower, or other vegetables to the masala sauce for added flavor and nutrients.
Substitute the heavy cream with coconut cream or Greek yogurt for a lighter version.
Serve with basmati rice, naan bread, or roti for a more authentic Indian experience.
Experiment with different spice levels by adjusting the amount of cayenne pepper or adding other spices, like cumin or coriander.
cooking_ingredients:
For the chicken:

1 1/2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken breast or thighs, cut into 1 1/2-inch pieces
1/2 cup plain yogurt
2 tablespoons lemon juice
2 tablespoons ghee or vegetable oil
2 teaspoons garam masala
1 teaspoon ground cumin
1/2 teaspoon ground coriander
1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1/4 teaspoon ground cardamom
1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional)
Salt and pepper, to taste
For the masala sauce:

2 tablespoons ghee or vegetable oil
1 onion, diced
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 can (14 oz) diced tomatoes
1 cup chicken broth
1/2 cup heavy cream
2 tablespoons tomato paste
2 teaspoons garam masala
1 teaspoon ground cumin
Salt and pepper, to taste
Fresh cilantro, for garnish

name: Banana Bread
description: A moist and delicious quick bread
ingredients: bananas, flour, sugar, eggs, butter, baking soda, vanilla extract
cooking_instruction:
Preheat the oven to 350°F. Generously grease a 9 by 5-inch loaf pan.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugars, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.
In another bowl, combine the mashed bananas, yogurt or sour cream, eggs, melted butter, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract.
Add the wet mixture to the dry mixture and stir until just combined. Do not overmix.
Fold in the chopped walnuts or chocolate chips, if using.
Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan and smooth the top.
Bake for about 1 hour, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean.
Remove the loaf from the oven and let it cool in the pan for 10 minutes.
Transfer the loaf to a wire rack to cool completely.
cooking_ingredients:
2 cups (254 grams) all-purpose flour
1/2 cup (100 grams) granulated sugar
1/2 cup (100 grams) light brown sugar
3/4 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon (optional)
1/2 teaspoon fine salt
1 1/2 cups (340 grams) mashed overripe bananas (about 3 large bananas)
1/4 cup (60 grams) plain yogurt or sour cream
2 large eggs, lightly beaten
3 tablespoons (42 grams) unsalted butter, melted
3 tablespoons vegetable oil
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 cup coarsely chopped toasted walnuts (142 grams) or chocolate chips (170 grams) (optional)

name: Beef Stroganoff
ingredients: beef strips, mushrooms, onions, sour cream, beef broth, egg noodles, paprika
cooking_instruction:
Prepare the ingredients: Slice the beef into thin strips and season with salt and pepper. Chop the onion and mushrooms, and mince the garlic.
Sear the beef: Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the beef and cook until browned, about 2-3 minutes. Remove the beef from the skillet and set aside.
Soften the onions: Reduce heat to medium and add the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
Add aromatics: Add the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute, until fragrant.
Add mushrooms: Add the sliced mushrooms and cook until they release their liquid and start to brown, about 3-4 minutes.
Add tomato paste and spices: Add the tomato paste, Dijon mustard, paprika, and thyme. Cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Add beef broth and flour: Add the beef broth and flour, whisking continuously to avoid lumps. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for 2 minutes, until slightly thickened.
Return the beef: Add the browned beef back to the skillet and stir to coat with the sauce. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, until the beef is cooked to your desired level of doneness.
Stir in sour cream: Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the sour cream. If using, add an additional 1 teaspoon of Dijon mustard.
Serve: Serve the Beef Stroganoff over cooked egg noodles, garnished with chopped fresh parsley or dill.
cooking_ingredients:
1 pound (450g) beef strips (sirloin or ribeye), cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) pieces
2 tablespoons (30g) vegetable oil
1 onion, finely chopped
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 cup (250g) mushrooms, sliced
1 tablespoon (15g) tomato paste
2 tablespoons (30g) Dijon mustard
1 teaspoon paprika
1/2 teaspoon dried thyme
Salt and pepper, to taste
1 cup (250ml) beef broth
1 tablespoon (15g) all-purpose flour
1 cup (250ml) sour cream
1 teaspoon Dijon mustard (optional)
Chopped fresh parsley or dill, for garnish
Cooked egg noodles, for serving

name: Caprese Salad
ingredients: tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, basil, balsamic vinegar, olive oil
cooking_instruction:
Arrange the tomatoes: On a large plate or platter, arrange the tomato slices in a single layer, leaving a small border around the edges.
Add the mozzarella: Place a mozzarella slice on top of each tomato slice.
Drizzle with olive oil: Drizzle the olive oil over the salad, making sure each tomato and mozzarella slice is coated with a thin layer of oil.
Drizzle with balsamic vinegar: Drizzle the balsamic vinegar over the salad, using a gentle hand to avoid overpowering the other flavors.
Sprinkle with basil: Sprinkle the chopped basil leaves over the salad, making sure to distribute them evenly.
Season with salt and pepper: Season the salad with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
Serve: Serve the Caprese Salad immediately, garnished with additional basil leaves if desired.
cooking_ingredients:
3 large, ripe tomatoes, sliced into 1/4-inch (6 mm) thick rounds
8 ounces (225g) fresh mozzarella cheese, sliced into 1/4-inch (6 mm) thick rounds
1/4 cup (15g) extra-virgin olive oil
2 tablespoons (30g) balsamic vinegar
1/4 cup (15g) fresh basil leaves, chopped
Salt, to taste
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste

name: Pho
ingredients: rice noodles, beef,chicken, bean sprouts, herbs, lime, chili, fish sauce, star anise, cinnamon
cooking_instruction:
Step 1: Make the Broth

Roast the bones: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Place the beef bones on a baking sheet and roast for 30 minutes, or until browned.
Make the broth: In a large stockpot, combine the roasted bones, beef brisket or chuck, fish sauce, soy sauce, sugar, onion, garlic, ginger, star anise, cinnamon stick, cinnamon, cloves, and cardamom. Pour in the beef broth and water, and bring to a boil.
Simmer the broth: Reduce the heat to low and simmer the broth for at least 1 hour, or overnight. Strain the broth through a fine-mesh sieve into a clean pot, discarding the solids.
Step 2: Cook the Noodles

Soak the noodles: Soak the rice noodles in hot water for 5-7 minutes, or according to the package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Step 3: Assemble the Pho

Slice the rare steak: Slice the rare steak into thin strips.
Assemble the bowls: Divide the cooked noodles among four bowls. Add slices of rare steak to each bowl.
Add the hot broth: Ladle the hot broth over the noodles and steak.
Add toppings: Garnish with bean sprouts, lime wedges, fresh basil leaves, fresh mint leaves, chili sauce, and hoisin sauce. Serve immediately.
cooking_ingredients:
Broth:

4 pounds (1.8 kg) beef bones (preferably oxtail or beef neck bones)
2 pounds (0.9 kg) beef brisket or chuck, sliced into thin strips
2 tablespoons (30g) fish sauce
2 tablespoons (30g) soy sauce
2 tablespoons (30g) sugar
1 onion, sliced
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 piece ginger, sliced
1 star anise
1 cinnamon stick
1 tablespoon (15g) ground cinnamon
1 tablespoon (15g) ground cloves
1 tablespoon (15g) ground cardamom
4 cups (1L) beef broth
2 cups (475ml) water
Salt, to taste
Noodles:

1 pound (450g) rice noodles (preferably fresh)
Toppings:

Thinly sliced rare steak (such as ribeye or sirloin)
Bean sprouts
Lime wedges
Fresh basil leaves
Fresh mint leaves
Chili sauce
Hoisin sauce
Pickled ginger

name: Tiramisu
ingredients: ladyfingers, espresso, mascarpone cheese, eggs, sugar, cocoa powder
cooking_instruction:
Step 1: Prepare the Coffee Syrup

In a small bowl, combine the brewed coffee, cocoa powder, and sugar. Stir until the sugar is dissolved.
Add the rum or coffee liqueur, if using. Stir to combine.
Step 2: Dip the Ladyfingers

Dip each ladyfinger into the coffee syrup for about 3-5 seconds on each side. They should be soft and pliable but not too wet.
Place the dipped ladyfingers on a wire rack or paper towels to drain excess coffee.
Step 3: Prepare the Mascarpone Cream

In a medium bowl, beat the mascarpone cheese and granulated sugar until smooth.
Beat in the egg yolks one at a time, until well combined.
Beat in the vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, whip the heavy cream until stiff peaks form.
Fold the whipped cream into the mascarpone mixture until no white streaks remain.
Step 4: Assemble the Tiramisu

In a large serving dish, create a layer of ladyfingers. You may need to trim them to fit the dish.
Spread half of the mascarpone cream over the ladyfingers.
Repeat the layers: ladyfingers, mascarpone cream.
Dust the top of the tiramisu with cocoa powder.
Step 5: Refrigerate and Serve

Cover the dish with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 3 hours or overnight.
Slice and serve. You can also freeze the tiramisu for up to 3 months and thaw in the refrigerator before serving.
cooking_ingredients:
For the ladyfingers:

12-16 ladyfingers (about 3 ounces)
For the coffee syrup:

1 cup of strong brewed coffee
1 tablespoon unsweetened cocoa powder
1 tablespoon granulated sugar
2 tablespoons rum or other coffee liqueur (optional)
For the mascarpone cream:

8 ounces mascarpone cheese
1/2 cup granulated sugar
2 large egg yolks
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 cup heavy cream, whipped

name: Falafel
ingredients: chickpeas, onions, garlic, parsley, cumin, coriander, flour
cooking_instruction:
Prepare the falafel mixture: If using a package mix, follow the instructions to mix with water. If making homemade falafel, combine chickpeas, herbs, and spices in a food processor until coarsely chopped.
Shape the falafel: Using your hands, shape the mixture into small patties or balls, about 1 1/2 inches in diameter. You should end up with around 8-10 falafels.
Heat the oil: In a large skillet, heat about 1-2 inches (2.5-5 cm) of vegetable oil over medium-high heat until it reaches 350°F (175°C).
Fry the falafels: Carefully place the falafels in the hot oil. Do not overcrowd the skillet. Fry for 3-4 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and crispy.
Drain excess oil: Using a slotted spoon, remove the falafels from the oil and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.
Season with salt and spices: Sprinkle the falafels with salt and any desired spices, such as paprika or garlic powder.
Serve: Serve the falafels hot in a pita bread with your favorite toppings, such as tahini sauce, lettuce, tomatoes, and pickles
cooking_ingredients:
1 package of falafel mix (or homemade falafel mixture)
Vegetable oil for frying
Salt, to taste
Optional: paprika, garlic powder, or other spices of your choice

name: Enchiladas
description: A Mexican dish with tortillas filled with various ingredients
ingredients: corn tortillas, chicken,beef,cheese, enchilada sauce, cheese, onions, olives
cooking_instruction:
Step 1: Prepare the Meat Filling

In a large skillet, cook the ground beef over medium-high heat until browned, breaking it up into small pieces as it cooks.
Add the diced onion and minced garlic to the skillet and cook until the onion is translucent.
Season the meat mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
Step 2: Prepare the Tortillas

Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Wrap the tortillas in a damp paper towel and microwave for 20-30 seconds to make them more pliable.
Step 3: Assemble the Enchiladas

In a separate skillet, warm the enchilada sauce over medium heat.
To assemble the enchiladas, lay a tortilla flat and spoon some of the meat mixture onto the center of the tortilla.
Roll the tortilla up and place it seam-side down in a baking dish. Repeat with the remaining tortillas and meat mixture.
Pour the warmed enchilada sauce over the rolled tortillas and sprinkle with shredded cheese.
Step 4: Bake the Enchiladas

Cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake for 25 minutes.
Remove the foil and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Step 5: Serve and Enjoy!

Remove the enchiladas from the oven and sprinkle with chopped cilantro.
Serve hot with your choice of toppings, such as diced tomatoes, shredded lettuce, diced avocado, sour cream, and salsa.
cooking_ingredients:
8-10 corn tortillas
1 pound ground beef (or ground turkey, chicken, or beans for a vegetarian option)
1 onion, diced
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 can (10 oz) enchilada sauce
1 cup shredded cheese (Cheddar or Monterey Jack work well)
1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro
Salt and pepper, to taste
Optional toppings: diced tomatoes, shredded lettuce, diced avocado, sour cream, salsa

name: Guacamole
ingredients: avocado, cilantro, red onion, salt
cooking_instruction:
Cut and pit the avocados: Slice the avocados in half, remove the pit, and scoop them into a mixing bowl.
Mash the avocados: Use a fork to mash the avocado flesh to your desired level of chunkiness or smoothness.
Add the onion, tomatoes, cilantro, jalapeno, and garlic: Add the diced onion, tomatoes, chopped cilantro, diced jalapeno, and minced garlic to the bowl with the mashed avocado.
Squeeze in the lime juice: Squeeze the juice of 1 lime over the mixture to prevent browning and add flavor.
Season with salt: Sprinkle ½ teaspoon of sea salt over the mixture and stir well.
Taste and adjust: Give the guacamole a taste test and adjust the seasoning if needed. You can add more lime juice, salt, or even a dash of pepper to taste.
Serve: Cover the bowl with plastic wrap, pressing the wrap directly onto the surface of the guacamole to prevent air from reaching it. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together. Serve with tortilla chips, on tacos, or as a dip for your favorite snacks!
cooking_ingredients:
3 ripe avocados
½ small yellow onion, finely diced
2 Roma tomatoes, diced
3 tablespoons finely chopped fresh cilantro
1 jalapeno pepper, seeds removed and finely diced
2 garlic cloves, minced
1 lime, juiced
½ teaspoon sea salt

name: Stir-Fry with Beef and Broccoli
description: A quick and flavorful Asian dish
ingredients: beef, broccoli, red bell pepper, soy sauce, sesame oil, ginger, garlic, rice
cooking_instruction:
Step 1: Prepare the ingredients

Cut the beef into thin strips and season with salt and pepper. Set aside.
Cut the broccoli into florets and set aside.
Mince the garlic and grate the ginger. Set aside.
Step 2: Cook the beef

Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat.
Add the beef to the skillet and cook for 3-4 minutes, or until browned and cooked through. Remove the beef from the skillet and set aside.
Step 3: Cook the broccoli and aromatics

In the same skillet, add the remaining 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil.
Add the minced garlic and grated ginger to the skillet and cook for 1 minute, or until fragrant.
Add the broccoli to the skillet and cook for 3-4 minutes, or until tender-crisp.
Step 4: Combine the beef and broccoli

Add the cooked beef back into the skillet with the broccoli.
Pour in the soy sauce, oyster sauce (if using), and sesame oil. Stir everything together to combine.
Step 5: Season and serve

Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed.
Serve the beef and broccoli stir-fry over cooked rice or noodles.
cooking_ingredients:
1 pound beef (sirloin or ribeye), sliced into thin strips
2 cups broccoli florets
2 tablespoons vegetable oil
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger
1 tablespoon soy sauce
1 tablespoon oyster sauce (optional)
1 teaspoon sesame oil
Salt and pepper, to taste
Cooked rice or noodles, for serving

name: French Fries
ingredients: potatoes, vegetable oil, salt
cooking_instruction:
Step 1: Prepare the Potatoes

Wash the potatoes thoroughly and dry them with a clean towel or paper towels.
Peel the potatoes using a vegetable peeler or a sharp knife.
Cut the potatoes into long, thin strips. You can either cut them by hand or use a French fry cutter. Try to make the strips as uniform as possible so that they cook evenly.
Step 2: Soak the Potatoes

To remove excess starch and help the fries become crispy, soak the cut potatoes in cold water for at least 30 minutes. After soaking, drain the potatoes and pat them dry with paper towels to remove excess moisture.
Step 3: Heat the Oil

Fill a large pot or deep fryer with vegetable oil to a depth of about 2-3 inches. The ideal temperature for frying French fries is between 325°F (165°C) and 375°F (190°C).
Heat the oil over medium-high heat until it reaches the desired temperature. Use a thermometer to monitor the temperature.
Step 4: Fry the Potatoes

Carefully add the potato strips to the hot oil in batches, being careful not to overcrowd the pot. Fry for 3-5 minutes or until they reach a light golden color.
Use a slotted spoon or skimmer to remove the fries from the oil and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.
Step 5: Double-Fry for Crispiness (Optional)

For extra crispy French fries, repeat the frying process a second time. Heat the oil to the desired temperature again, and then fry the blanched potatoes in batches for an additional 2-3 minutes or until they reach a golden brown color.
Step 6: Season and Serve

Sprinkle the French fries with salt and any additional seasonings you like.
Serve the French fries hot and enjoy!
cooking_ingredients:
2-3 large potatoes
Vegetable oil for frying (about 2-3 inches deep in a pot)
Salt, to taste
Optional: Additional seasonings, such as paprika, garlic powder, or chili powder

name: Spring Rolls
description: A Vietnamese appetizer with savory filling
ingredients: rice paper wrappers, pork,shrimp,vegetables, vermicelli noodles, lettuce, mint, fish sauce
cooking_instruction:
Step 1: Prepare the Filling

Choose your desired filling ingredients and prepare them according to your preference. For example, chop the vegetables, cook the meat or shrimp, and season with salt and pepper.
Step 2: Assemble the Spring Rolls

Lay a spring roll wrapper on a flat surface with one corner pointing towards you (like a diamond).
Place about 1 tablespoon of filling in the center of the wrapper.
Brush the edges of the wrapper with a small amount of water.
Fold the bottom corner of the wrapper over the filling, then fold in the sides and roll up the wrapper to form a tight cylinder. Repeat with the remaining wrappers and filling.
Step 3: Fry the Spring Rolls

Heat about 2-3 inches (5-7.5 cm) of vegetable oil in a deep frying pan or a deep fryer to 350°F (175°C).
When the oil is hot, carefully add a few spring rolls to the oil (do not overcrowd).
Fry the spring rolls for 3-5 minutes on each side, or until they are golden brown and crispy.
Remove the spring rolls from the oil with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
Step 4: Serve and Enjoy

Serve the spring rolls hot with your favorite dipping sauce, such as soy sauce, oyster sauce, or a sweet chili sauce.
You can also serve them with a side of fresh vegetables, such as lettuce, carrots, and cucumbers.
cooking_ingredients:
1 package of spring roll wrappers (usually found in the Asian food section of the supermarket)
Filling ingredients (choose one or a combination):
Vegetarian: shredded carrots, cabbage, bean sprouts, scallions, tofu, and vermicelli noodles
Meat-based: ground pork, chicken, or beef, mixed with shredded vegetables and noodles
Shrimp: cooked and peeled shrimp, mixed with shredded vegetables and noodles
Vegetable oil for frying
Salt and pepper, to taste
Optional: soy sauce, oyster sauce, or other dipping sauces

name: Ratatouille
ingredients: eggplant, zucchini, tomatoes, bell peppers, garlic, olive oil, herbs
cooking_instruction:
Preheat the oven: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).

Prepare the vegetables: Slice the eggplant, tomatoes, squash, and zucchini into approximately ¹⁄₁₆-inch (1-mm)-thick rounds. Set them aside.

Make the sauce: Heat olive oil in a 12-inch (30-cm) oven-safe pan over medium-high heat. Sauté the onion, garlic, and bell peppers until soft, about 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, then add the crushed tomatoes. Stir until the ingredients are fully incorporated. Remove from heat, then add the basil. Stir once more, then smooth the surface of the sauce with a spatula.

Assemble the ratatouille: Arrange the vegetables in alternating slices (for example, eggplant, tomato, squash, zucchini) on top of the sauce, working from the outer edge to the center of the pan. Season with salt and pepper.

Add the herb seasoning: Mix together the basil, garlic, parsley, thyme, salt, pepper, and olive oil in a small bowl. Spoon the herb seasoning over the vegetables.

Bake: Cover the pan with foil and bake for 40 minutes. Uncover, then bake for another 20 minutes, until the vegetables are softened.

Serve: Serve hot as a main dish or side. The ratatouille is also excellent the next day–cover with foil and reheat in a 350°F (180°C) oven for 15 minutes, or simply microwave to desired temperature.
cooking_ingredients:
Vegetables:

2 large eggplants, sliced into ¹⁄₁₆-inch (1-mm) thick rounds
2 large zucchinis, sliced into ¹⁄₁₆-inch (1-mm) thick rounds
2 large yellow squash, sliced into ¹⁄₁₆-inch (1-mm) thick rounds
2 large tomatoes, sliced into ¹⁄₁₆-inch (1-mm) thick rounds
1 large onion, chopped
3 cloves of garlic, minced
2 large bell peppers (any color), chopped
Sauce:

2 cups of crushed tomatoes
2 tablespoons of olive oil
Salt and pepper, to taste
Fresh basil leaves, chopped (optional)
Herb Seasoning:

2 tablespoons of olive oil
2 cloves of garlic, minced
1 tablespoon of chopped fresh parsley
1 tablespoon of chopped fresh thyme
Salt and pepper, to taste
Other:

Fresh basil leaves, chopped (for garnish)
Grated cheese (such as Parmesan or mozzarella), optional

name: Pasta Primavera
description: A light and flavorful pasta dish with spring vegetables
ingredients: pasta, garlic, olive oil, parmesan cheese
cooking_instruction:
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions until al dente. Reserve 1 cup of pasta water before draining.
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until translucent, about 3-4 minutes.
Add the minced garlic and cook for an additional minute, until fragrant.
Add the mixed spring vegetables and cook until they're tender-crisp, about 3-4 minutes.
Add the frozen peas and carrots and cook until thawed and heated through.
In a small bowl, whisk together the broth, Dijon mustard, and dried basil. Pour the mixture over the vegetables in the skillet.
Add the cooked pasta to the skillet, tossing everything together to combine. If the pasta seems dry, add some of the reserved pasta water.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, topped with grated Parmesan cheese and chopped fresh parsley if desired.
cooking_ingredients:
8 oz (225g) pasta of your choice (e.g., bowtie, penne, or linguine)
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 small onion, chopped
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 cup (115g) mixed spring vegetables (e.g., cherry tomatoes, bell peppers, carrots, zucchini, and snap peas)
1 cup (115g) frozen peas and carrots
1/2 cup (120ml) chicken or vegetable broth
1 tablespoon Dijon mustard
1 teaspoon dried basil
Salt and pepper, to taste
Grated Parmesan cheese, optional (about 1/2 cup or 55g)
Fresh parsley, chopped (optional)

name: Jambalaya
description: A Creole dish with rice meat and seafood
ingredients: rice, chicken, sausage, shrimp, celery, tomatoes, cajun seasoning
cooking_instruction:
Brown the sausage: Brown sliced andouille sausage in a little bit of olive oil. It's already cooked, so it shouldn't take too long to brown!
Sauté the Holy Trinity: Add in a little bit more olive oil along with the green pepper, onion, celery, and garlic. Sauté until slightly softened, about three minutes.
Add the rest of the ingredients: Add in tomato paste, canned tomatoes, chicken stock, a little bit of salt, spices, and rice. Stir to combine.
Bring to a boil and simmer: Bring the mixture up to a boil, and then reduce to a low simmer and cover. Let the stove do the work! Cook the rice and veggies until the rice is puffed and cooked, about 20 minutes.
Add the shrimp and chicken: When the rice is just shy of being done, add in the shrimp and shredded chicken. Cook for 4-5 minutes until pink.
Garnish and season: Garnish with green onion and season to taste with salt and pepper.
cooking_ingredients:
The Cajun/Creole "holy trinity": Celery, onion, and green bell pepper (although you can also use red and yellow bell peppers for extra color)
Jalapeño and cayenne: For heat, feel free to add more or less of either depending on your heat preferences
Garlic, Creole or Cajun seasoning, bay leaf, thyme: Some essential seasonings
Chicken, shrimp, and Andouille sausage: Or whatever proteins you prefer, feel free to choose one or two, or use all three like I do
Chicken stock: If the rice needs more liquid as it cooks, feel free to add in more
Crushed tomatoes: For flavor
White rice: Long grain is traditional, but short grain white rice also works
Okra: Fresh or frozen; we will use this to help thicken the jambalaya
Salt and Black Pepper: Very important! Don't forget to taste and season with salt and pepper to taste at the end

name: Chili
description: A hearty and spicy stew with meat and beans
ingredients: ground beef,turkey, kidney beans, black beans, tomatoes, chili powder, cumin, garlic
cooking_instruction:
Step 1: Brown the Ground Beef

In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat 1-2 tablespoons of oil over medium-high heat.
Add 1-2 pounds of ground beef (you can use ground turkey, chicken, or beans for a vegetarian option) and cook until browned, breaking it up into small pieces as it cooks.
Once browned, drain the excess fat from the pot.
Step 2: Soften the Onions and Garlic

Add 1 large onion, diced, and 3-4 cloves of garlic, minced, to the pot.
Cook until the onions are translucent and the garlic is fragrant, about 5 minutes.
Step 3: Add the Aromatics and Spices

Add 1-2 teaspoons of chili powder, 1 teaspoon of ground cumin, and 1/2 teaspoon of paprika to the pot.
Cook for 1-2 minutes, until the spices are fragrant.
Add 1-2 diced bell peppers (any color) and 2-3 diced jalapeños (optional) to the pot.
Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.
Step 4: Add the Tomatoes and Beans

Add 1 can (14.5 oz) of diced tomatoes, 1 can (15 oz) of red kidney beans, drained and rinsed, and 1 can (16 oz) of pinto beans, drained and rinsed, to the pot.
Stir to combine.
Step 5: Add the Broth and Simmer

Add 1-2 cups of beef broth (or vegetable broth for a vegetarian option) to the pot.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 30-60 minutes, until the flavors have melded together and the chili has thickened.
Step 6: Season and Serve

Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped onions, shredded cheese, sour cream, or crushed tortilla chips.
cooking_ingredients:
Meat:

1-2 pounds ground beef (you can use ground turkey, chicken, or beans for a vegetarian option)
Aromatics:

1 large onion, diced
3-4 cloves of garlic, minced
2-3 diced bell peppers (any color)
2-3 diced jalapeños (optional)
Spices:

1-2 teaspoons chili powder
1 teaspoon ground cumin
1/2 teaspoon paprika
Salt and pepper, to taste
Optional: cayenne pepper, oregano, or other spices of your choice
Tomatoes:

1 can (14.5 oz) diced tomatoes
1 can (15 oz) crushed tomatoes (optional)
Beans:

1 can (15 oz) red kidney beans, drained and rinsed
1 can (16 oz) pinto beans, drained and rinsed
Optional: black beans, kidney beans, or other types of beans
Broth:

1-2 cups beef broth (or vegetable broth for a vegetarian option)
Other:

1 tablespoon tomato paste (optional)
1/4 cup water
Brown sugar, to taste (optional)
Worcestershire sauce, to taste (optional)
Toppings:

Shredded cheese (cheddar, Monterey Jack, or Pepper Jack)
Sour cream
Diced onions
Crushed tortilla chips
Sliced jalapeños
Cilantro, chopped (optional)

name: Burrito Bowl
description: A customizable Mexican dish served in a bowl
ingredients: rice, cheese, salsa, guacamole, sour cream
cooking_instruction:
Step 1: Cook the Rice

In a medium saucepan, bring the water or broth to a boil.
Add the rice and reduce the heat to low. Cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the water is absorbed and the rice is tender.
Step 2: Prepare the Vegetables

In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat.
Add the diced onion, bell pepper, and zucchini. Cook for 5-7 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
Step 3: Add the Protein and Spices

Add the cooked chicken breast (or ground beef, beans, or tofu) to the skillet. Cook for 2-3 minutes, or until heated through.
Add the cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper to the skillet. Stir to combine.
Step 4: Assemble the Burrito Bowl

In a large bowl, add a scoop of cooked rice.
Add the vegetable and protein mixture on top of the rice.
Add the diced tomatoes and any desired toppings (avocado, sour cream, shredded cheese, etc.).
Step 5: Serve and Enjoy!

Serve the burrito bowl hot and enjoy!
cooking_ingredients:
Grains:

1 cup uncooked white or brown rice
Protein:

1 cup cooked chicken breast, diced (or ground beef, beans, or tofu for alternative options)
Vegetables:

1 small onion, diced
1 small bell pepper, diced
1 small zucchini, diced
1 can (14.5 oz) diced tomatoes, drained
1 cup frozen corn kernels, thawed
1 cup black beans, cooked and drained (optional)
Spices and Seasonings:

1 teaspoon cumin
1 teaspoon chili powder
1/2 teaspoon paprika
Salt and pepper, to taste
Optional: cayenne pepper, oregano, or other spices of your choice
Oils and Sauces:

1 tablespoon olive oil
1 tablespoon lime juice (optional)
1 tablespoon salsa (optional)
1 tablespoon sour cream (optional)
Toppings:

Avocado, diced
Sour cream
Shredded cheese (cheddar, Monterey Jack, or Pepper Jack)
Diced tomatoes
Cilantro, chopped
Crushed tortilla chips
Sliced jalapeños or hot sauce (optional)
Other:

Water or vegetable broth for cooking the rice
Salt, for seasoning

name: Cobb Salad
description: A classic American salad with various ingredients
ingredients: chicken, bacon, avocado, cucumber, romaine lettuce, hard-boiled egg, red onion
cooking_instruction:
For the Dressing:

In a small bowl, whisk together 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar, 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard, 1 teaspoon honey, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Slowly drizzle in 1/4 cup olive oil, whisking constantly until the dressing is emulsified.
For the Salad:

Prepare your ingredients: Hard-boil 2 eggs, cook 4 slices of bacon until crispy, and poach or grill 1 chicken breast.
Wash and dry 1 head of romaine or iceberg lettuce, then chop it into bite-sized pieces.
Peel and chop the hard-boiled eggs, crumble the cooked bacon, and slice the chicken breast.
Slice 1 avocado and 2 tomatoes.
In a large bowl, combine the lettuce, eggs, bacon, chicken, avocado, and tomatoes.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Garnish with chopped chives and serve immediately.
cooking_ingredients:
Protein:

1 boneless, skinless chicken breast
4 slices of bacon
2 hard-boiled eggs
Produce:

1 head of romaine or iceberg lettuce
1 ripe avocado
2 large tomatoes
1/4 cup of fresh chives
Dairy:

1/2 cup of crumbled blue cheese (optional)
Pantry:

2 tablespoons of red wine vinegar
1 teaspoon of Dijon mustard
1 teaspoon of honey
Salt and pepper to taste
1/4 cup of olive oil
Miscellaneous:

Cooking oil or spray for cooking the chicken and bacon

name: Kung Pao Chicken
description: A spicy and flavorful Chinese dish
ingredients: chicken, peanuts, red bell pepper, cashews, soy sauce, rice vinegar, chili paste, ginger, garlic
cooking_instruction:
Prepare the ingredients: Mince the garlic, dice the onion, and mince the ginger. Toast the Szechuan peppercorns in a small dry pan over medium heat until fragrant, then grind them into a powder.
Marinate the chicken: In a medium bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, and cornstarch. Add the chicken and toss to coat. Let marinate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 2 hours in the refrigerator.
Heat the wok or skillet: Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add the chicken and cook until browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the chicken from the wok and set aside.
Stir-fry the aromatics: In the same wok, add the remaining 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil. Add the minced garlic, diced onion, and minced ginger. Stir-fry until the aromatics are fragrant and the onion is translucent, about 30 seconds.
Add the chili bean paste (if using): If using chili bean paste, add it to the wok and stir-fry for 10-15 seconds, until fragrant.
Add the peanuts and scallions: Add the roasted peanuts and chopped scallions to the wok. Stir-fry for 1 minute, until the peanuts are fragrant.
Add the chili flakes and Szechuan peppercorns: Add the red pepper flakes and toasted Szechuan peppercorns to the wok. Stir-fry for 10-15 seconds, until fragrant.
Return the chicken to the wok: Add the cooked chicken back to the wok and stir-fry until everything is well combined.
Season with salt and pepper: Taste and adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper as needed.
Serve: Serve the Kung Pao Chicken immediately, garnished with additional scallions and peanuts if desired.
cooking_ingredients:
1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
2 tablespoons vegetable oil
3 cloves garlic, minced
1 small onion, diced
1 tablespoon ginger, minced
1 tablespoon Szechuan peppercorns, toasted and ground
1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes (or more to taste)
1/2 cup roasted peanuts or cashews
1/4 cup scallions, chopped
2 tablespoons soy sauce
2 tablespoons Shaoxing wine (or dry sherry)
1 tablespoon cornstarch
Salt and pepper to taste
2 tablespoons chili bean paste (doubanjiang) (optional)

name: Tofu Scramble
description: A vegan alternative to scrambled eggs
ingredients: tofu, turmeric, nutritional yeast, black pepper
cooking_instruction:
Heat the oil: In a large non-stick skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat.
Sauté the onion and garlic: Add the diced onion and minced garlic to the skillet. Cook until the onion is translucent, about 3-4 minutes.
Add the tofu: Add the crumbled tofu to the skillet. Use a spatula to break up the tofu into small curds.
Add the spices: Add the turmeric, paprika, salt, and pepper to the skillet. Stir well to combine.
Scramble the tofu: Use the spatula to scramble the tofu, breaking it up into small curds. Cook for about 5-7 minutes, until the tofu is lightly browned and scrambled.
Add optional vegetables: If using, add chopped bell peppers, mushrooms, spinach, or other vegetables to the skillet. Cook until they're tender.
Serve: Serve the tofu scramble hot, garnished with chopped fresh herbs or chives, if desired.
cooking_ingredients:
1 block of firm or extra-firm tofu, drained and crumbled
1 tablespoon olive oil
1 small onion, diced
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 teaspoon turmeric
1 teaspoon paprika
Salt and pepper, to taste
Optional: Chopped bell peppers, mushrooms, spinach, or other vegetables of your choice

name: Lentil Soup
description: A hearty and healthy soup with lentils and vegetables
ingredients: lentils, carrots, celery, garlic, vegetable broth
cooking_instruction:
Step 1: Saute the Aromatics (10 minutes)

Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add the chopped onion, minced garlic, chopped carrots, and chopped celery.
Cook until the vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes.
Stir occasionally to prevent burning.
Step 2: Add the Lentils and Spices (1 minute)

Add the rinsed and drained lentils to the pot.
Stir to combine with the aromatics.
Add the ground cumin, dried thyme, ground cayenne pepper (if using), salt, and black pepper.
Cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Step 3: Add the Liquid and Vegetables (10 minutes)

Add the diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, and water to the pot.
Stir to combine.
Add the diced red bell pepper and potatoes (if using).
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low.
Simmer, covered, for 30-40 minutes, or until the lentils are tender.
Step 4: Blend and Season (10 minutes)

Use an immersion blender to puree the soup to your desired consistency.
Alternatively, you can transfer the soup to a blender and blend in batches, then return it to the pot.
Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed.
Add more water if the soup is too thick, or simmer for a few more minutes if it's too thin.
Step 5: Serve and Enjoy!

Ladle the soup into bowls.
